website_summaries.verdict: Gives the whole car a brand-new look.
pros: For handling light scratches and swirls
A great formula that works well when used by hand or with a polisher or rotary buffer
Customers love this product for its ability to handle oxidation
cons: Though this product works well, many customers find it difficult to remove

customer_reviews.title: Brought the Del Sol back to life.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very easy product to use, it cut thru my paint oxidation like butter every one I took it to said the car just needed to be repainted at 2500 plus so I figured I would give this a try after reading reviews on different products this was the best option I ordered it along with the 205 and I picked up a DA buffer and pads at a local HF store and went to town three days later doing a few hours a day you can see the results I think I did pretty good for a first timer. I also used meguiar's m205 and a gold class wax. Great products
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: Say Goodbye To Ultimate Compound
customer_reviews.text: I've detailed cars for years. My go-to scratch/oxidation remover was Meg Ultimate Compound. I tried this out with my Meg DA polosher, Chem Guys Hex cutting pad and was STUNNED at how much better this worked than anything else Ive tried. I was worried it would be too abrasive, but it's perfectly safe. Even with 3 passes. I follow up w my fav polish and wax and I'm set. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: M105 is my go to for scratches and neglected clear ...
customer_reviews.text: M105 is my go to for scratches and neglected clear coat. This stuff with an orange pad is an unbelievable first stage of polishing. I use M105 and then M205 and then M66 for a 3 stage polish and wax.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua S

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm, not much flaking and easy to wipe off!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, works if used correctly. Used a Porter Cable DA with Orange Chemical Guys Cutting Pad. Removed large scratches from black paint on Kia Sportage, Black Cherry paint finish. This is what you want to use first to remove most scratches and rain and road damage. Way better than sanding, though sometimes you need to sand. Always try and cut with M105 first, then you can follow with M205 and a paste wax on the top!
customer_reviews.author: TURBODRIVER24

customer_reviews.title: Buy the bigger bottle.
customer_reviews.text: Good product but the bottle is too small to be worth buying. It produced minimal hazing that was easy to buff out with a fine cut compound. I bought it to refinish a 4-door Jeep Wrangler with extensive "Rocky Mountain Pin Stripes" and almost didn't have enough to finish. The application rate I was using didn't seem to waste much and any less would have run the buffer pad too dry. Maybe it would be good for 2-3 light to moderate car jobs if you know what you're doing.
customer_reviews.author: aaron bliesner

customer_reviews.title: Worked great to remove marks on my bumper
customer_reviews.text: Someone backed into my front bumper and left their black paint on my light colored bumper. This and a dual-action polisher worked like a magic eraser and took all 4 of the marks off in maybe 10 minutes. It also did a nice job of taking some of the road grime off using the same DA polisher and this stuff. Meg's always makes great stuff, sometimes it's hard to figure out what product is best. For refreshing paint and "erasing" bumper marks, this is what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Usually a great product; however, the second bottle I purchased seems to have a very different product inside. Make sure your purchase is coming from a reputable seller and check to make sure it hasn’t been tampered with before using. Update: Amazon replaced this item with a new one at no charge. The replacement is substantially thicker than the watery one I received before - so - I appreciate the replacement; however, this issue should be looked into. Not OK if somone is diluting product.
customer_reviews.author: LA DIY

customer_reviews.title: Stick with Maguires and you can’t go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Very good cutting compound. You get a good work time with this product and it removes heavy squirrels spider webbing and hazing from the paint and it gets ready for final polishing I would recommend this product to the professional or the novice. It’s a good standby product that’s been around for a long time and it is not overpriced like some of the new products on the market that all they do is dress them up with flashy packaging. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Rich v

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonders!
customer_reviews.text: I had a two foot long gash down the side of my black 2017 Lexus from when luggage fell. I was nervous to try anything on my own, but decided to try this after reading the reviews. I wish I would’ve taken a before photo, because the scratch is completely gone!! I used a foam applicator and did it by hand. It took maybe ten minutes. The scratch was fairly deep and a good quarter inch wide. I didn’t expect great results, but I’m pleasantly surprised and pleased. I highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: KnightTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Worked okay ... better than T.W. ... hard to wipe off.  Will not use again.
customer_reviews.text: I used this as the first step after wet sand for my 3 stage paint restoration process on a 1984 Suburban that had been sitting for 6 years. This made a some difference. Didn't get the 3000 grit scratches out like the Griots did. Seems to work okay. It was a pain to wipe off the residue after use. Tried Turtle Wax Rubbing Compound and Polishing Compound on a few panels in place of this 205 and the 105. The T.W. was easier to work with but the Meguiars seemed to work better. These pics are before any work and after many hours of paint restoration work. Drivers side looks good. Passenger side looks better than it did.
customer_reviews.author: G-NUT

customer_reviews.title: Surprise! Headlight restore!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to smooth out some scuffs and light scratches on the paint of my Nissan Pathfinder...decided on a whim to try this on the plastic headlights on the same vehicle and...WOW! In about 5 minutes, the lenses looked like brand new...with very little effort. Worked even better on a Toyota Tundra....literally, both headlights, less than 5 minutes, totally clear. Applied with a shop towel, buffed with a sponge wheel on my drill, polished with a lambswool pad on same drill. This stuff is legit. And yes, brought the shine back out on the paint on the vehicle to a lustrous sheen...I was impressed. Works as advertised. Will buy again..a little dab'll do you.
customer_reviews.author: Howdy

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! This took my new to me red mustang that had faded to pink and chalky and made it red and shiny again, used a clay bar before it then this 205 cutting followed by the 105 polish and man did it do a great job, car is show ready now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Shine achieved on severely damaged paint
customer_reviews.text: I was working on attempting to restore an old car hood that I had purchased many years ago from a junkyard. This was mostly just a practice project as I did not think that the paint was actually salvageable. I started out with Meguiars Ultimate Compound, which has worked great for me on less damaged surfaces; it did nothing for me on this severely weather damaged hood, however. I then purchased this Ultra-Cut compound. I was actually able to get impressive shine from the hood, when I wasn't sure if I'd be able to get reflectivity out of it at all. This stuff is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: goodness

customer_reviews.title: Removed fine swirls on black car
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about using a product like this but I decided to take a chance. While it says you can use by hand, I got tired after 5 minutes and did not get any results. I picked up some buffing pads that attach to my drill and got amazing results. While it did not get rid of the deep scratches, it did get nearly all the swirls and light scratches leaving the deep ones leftover for me to deal with. I rubbed the front fender against the stucco pillar from my house. I am ordering a paint filler pen, then I will clearcoat and wet sand and do the final buff with this product again to finish.
customer_reviews.author: LawrenceD

customer_reviews.title: Does the cutting power, but leaves alot of white dust
customer_reviews.text: This cutting compound by meguiars is great but has its flaws. It will defintley create white dust so please be advise. I ised it on my MAzerati Quattroporte as you can see in photos is a white car. I did not try it on a dark color car yet to see how bad the white dusting is, but based off how muh it accumated on my white car i can only imagine it will be worse on dark colored cars. I used a DA by torq with the orange cutting pad
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed, glad Amazon carries the smaller size
customer_reviews.text: I had to remove some damage from a parking lot but didn't need enough to open a whole body shop. Some of the scratches were through the clear to the paint. I wanted a temporary solution while I debate paying the body shop $900 to repaint. Some wetsanding and Meguires 105 did the trick. The scratches are barely noticeable except from very close and in bright light now. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Looks great when done right
customer_reviews.text: Less is more...and avoid using on a sun heated panel. Back of bottle hints to this, but if you're new to polishing you'll get nowhere and not know why. Heat will dry polish and have no affect on your clearcoat. If you must do this in the sun, lightly spray some water or another product to increase working time. And use on 1 panel at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn, NY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product!! Work small areas, product cuts while wet so work 12" squares and you will me amazed
customer_reviews.author: Brewmaster C

customer_reviews.title: Black truck is smooth and has a great shine
customer_reviews.text: My truck I had wanted to prep to vinyl wrap it, ended up adding wax instead as my results from this polish were pretty good my only downside is even with the 6 inch pad full of other panels polishing material and adding on a few drops extra to do each area I thought I used to much material. Anyways if you polish with this stuff hope you get great results as my truck turned out 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Josh V

customer_reviews.title: Removes swirls easily!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing better! I have had amazing results on every vehicle i have used it on. Both the cars in the picture i used this followed by Chemical Guys v36 and v38. I then put chemical guys butter wet wax over the top and the shine was amazing! One thing i am not a fan of is the powdery mess you get when you use this. The chemical guys v series doesn't make quite the mess and i would like to try their v32 to compare results. This is the deepest cutting compound i currently have and almost done with this bottle. Wont be disappointed in your results!
customer_reviews.author: Spencer S.Top Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Better than Chemical Guys V-series.
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my 2011 Basque red Honda Accord and had AMAZING results. Took out small scratches and swirls without much hassle. Leaves the paint looking very rich with a nice gloss. Goes on easy and wipes off clean. Paired with the orange Lake Country pad and a Torq DA polisher. This product works better than the Chemical Guys V line and is MUCH cheaper. I will be purchasing the M205 to follow this product up in the future. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Cutting polish but requires some skill.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using M105 and M305 for the last 10yrs, great combo polishes ( and you definitely need the M305 if you use 105) . Works great and quickly but the ONLY major negative is the dusting it creates and it can also be a pain in the arse to clean up afterward. Therefore I recommend it to those who have minor experience with polishing to avoid mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Good results but hard to remove
customer_reviews.text: This compound works well, however as alot of the other reviews state this stuff is really difficult to remove. It cures way faster than the chemical guys V line polishes even when working a small area. I had to resort to using alcohol to buff it off. Ive been given the tip that mixing in some M24 to increase the working time of the compound will help but i have not been able to try that. I ended up switching back to the V line compounds after one panel simply because of how hard this stuff bonds to the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Used on old oxidized car
customer_reviews.text: Good start on "black' car that was badly oxidized. Turned a rough "black" car into a sapphire blue metallic one. This was the 1 st. step in 3 levels of compound. After this I could see actual color of paint. Used w/ a random orbital buffer. Only gripe is, container dropped 2' onto floor and split down the middle. I ducted taped up, but really! This was was the second bottle from this brand do that.
customer_reviews.author: M. Belken

customer_reviews.title: Worked well to reduce swirls and imperfections and leaves a deep glossy appearance.  Follow up with M205
customer_reviews.text: Used this with a dual action polisher and orange pad. Worked well to reduce swirls and imperfections on Dodge with Patriot Blue paint. Followed up with M205. The paint was very glossy and wet-looking afterwards. The 105 is somewhat tacky and it takes a bit of effort to remove. I found a super fluffy microfiber towel with a deep pile worked well. A 50/50 mix of water & isopropyl alchohol will also take off any remaining tough residue. As this is a compound and you should follow with a polish anyway, if there is a little residue left over it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: JSMCO

customer_reviews.title: but if you keep up the pressure you can get great results. This product dries out quickly
customer_reviews.text: I probably don't use this product in the way it was intended. Every thread I've read about how to use it assumes that you're use a buffer of some sort. I'm using it to get out minor scratches and imperfections on the paint/clear of my truck....by hand. It did the job that Meguiar's M2 couldn't. It's made nearly half a dozen scratch marks disappear. It takes some elbow grease (I'm also 100% sure that I'm using a pad not rated for the job, too), but if you keep up the pressure you can get great results. This product dries out quickly, so keep a spray bottle handy and work small areas at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Sakurabart

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had a huge scratch down the side of my Jeep from a shopping cart. The instructions on the back weren't clear for how to use with just a buffing cloth but I watched a video and it was really easy to figure out. It took a couple passes to get the whole scratch but it looks perfect now. I still had quite a bit left so I went around and touched up some smaller scratches around the bumper and bottom of the doors. This stuff was absolutely worth it and for a first time user it wasn't hard to get the hang of at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Jane

customer_reviews.title: Meguiare's 105
customer_reviews.text: Essential in mirror finishing a varnish top coat for table tops. Used between 1500 grit final sanding and before 205 buffing compound. Helps level any "orange peel" film imperfections. Can be hand rubbed or DA machine worked. Does not leave swirl scratches. Can also be used as a middle step in head light polishing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T

customer_reviews.title: Used to get scratches caused by steel wool out
customer_reviews.text: I used 000 steel wool on my car to get a paint transfer off from a side swipe accident. That got the paint off for sure but left a dull spot behind. I came back and used M10508 cut compound with an orbital buffer and got my mirror shine back. I then went scratch hunting and took care of a few minor scratches as well.
customer_reviews.author: B. sindelar

customer_reviews.title: Not worth spending money on
customer_reviews.text: I had few very light scratches on the car and tried this product on that. After waiting and cleaning for 30 mins, the light scratches didnt went off. I must say that the car did shine after applying this product. However, I bought it after reading the description of the product which also mentions that it is very effective against the light scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Karishma

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: For this to be ultra cut, I expected more :( It was more like a polish than cutting compound. I will say that it buffs to nice shine. Like any other polish, you definitely want to keep this stuff away from rubber trim. It is really hard to remove this product once it dries on soft components.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Randall

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: I gotta tell ya, I was very impressed with the results. I had a bunch of scratches that looked bad on my rear bumper. I had tried rubbing compund which didn't do anything. I have a polishing ball that I put on a power drill and used this polish, and unless you know where they are and stare at it, you won't see them. It exceeded my expectations honestly. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: jason Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Works great for clear coat scratches
customer_reviews.text: It works well for clear coat scratches! Saved my entire driver side scratches and the other side had some deeper scratches but definitely less noticeable. While there are still scratches if you look very very closely, but just stepping back you can’t tell. ❤️ If you can rub your hand over the car and you don’t feel it carving into the car, it’s probably a clear coat scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Konginator

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Good
customer_reviews.text: I friend was telling me how some guy sold him some type of chemical in a bottle to restore the paint job on his car but he could not figure out what was in the bottle, the job done by the Unknown product was very mediocre, so I went and got my bottle of ”Meguiar’s Mirror Glaze Ultra-Cut Compound’ so him the miracle it can work and he don’t necessarily need to repaint his car, the image is just a small area a rub the compound on, he’s still amazed
customer_reviews.author: Jkmr880

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a few light scratches on my car (04 silver Maxima), not totally sure if I even needed to compound but I ran with it. After clay barring, I followed with the M105. It took care of some light scratches, maybe a higher cutting pad would have taken care of the deeper imperfections, but I rather start lighter then too heavy. I was kind of apprehensive as most with using compound, as I'm sure most are (newbie) but it applied very easy and wiped off even easier. Remember to keep the area your working small 2x2 and keep it moving.. FYI, I clay barred, compounded, polished, and waxed (6hrs) and my car looks great!!
customer_reviews.author: LRC3

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I am a newbie when it comes to polishing clear coat. I took my brand new variable speed buffer / polisher out of the box, stuck on an 8" foam pad, added some compound and went at it. The results were pretty amazing. I had a big scratch that I worked on and got it looking much less noticeable. Then I worked on a panel that I had wet sanded the clear coat with 1500 grit sandpaper. The finish was very dull. After polishing it up, it looked shiny and new. Very happy with this product. Especially since it could have gone bad with me being inexperienced with using a buffer/polisher.
customer_reviews.author: Tom T.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, removes scratches.
customer_reviews.text: This is good stuff. It's easy to work with by hand or with a buffer. Not only have I used it on my cars, but I've gone a step further, and used it ony appliances as well. It does a good job of removing scratches and defects.
customer_reviews.author: C Brown

customer_reviews.title: A must for paint correction
customer_reviews.text: This is a must for paint correction. M105 and M205 are the golden standard. The only thing I wish is they sold a middle size bottle, between this smaller 8 ounce and the very large 32 ounce. You always end up using a lot more than you anticipate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: It's a great compound. Much better to work with than most others. I used it with my electric buffer and did areas that need attention. It did help clear up an area that has started to cloud (a bit). I'll keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works alright.
customer_reviews.text: I expected more from a Meguiar's product. I would not call this an ultra-cut compound. I would like to see this be a little more abrasive, more cut to it. I would just use the Ultimate Compound and skip the ultra-cut compound.
customer_reviews.author: Big Ed

customer_reviews.title: Removed scratches the Swirl Remover did non
customer_reviews.text: This was a better step than the Meguires Swirl Remover 2.0 that I tried first. Only downside is that it will cause quite a bit of dust as you polish it in. It was able to remove most of the clearcoat scratches and swirls the other polish missed.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Very fast shipping. Easy to apply and remove works amazingly well it Remove small scratches and blemishes I didn’t know it could remove works great even with old Residue and glue left over from the stickers and logos I took off of my car. definitely a must have item!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Never disappointed with Meguiar's. I used this in conjunction with Meguiar's M205....to buff out my '66 Corvette....and it did a great job. Use one to cut and the other to polish. Lastly....the bottle was more than enough for one car.
customer_reviews.author: N. De Rosa

customer_reviews.title: then this is perfect product that will give you amazing result
customer_reviews.text: To be honest i personally found this product is very very hard to work with, if you have experience with detailing, then this is perfect product that will give you amazing result. By the small time i spent with it i found that it dried too quickly on the paint leaving me to use alot of detailing spray just to remove the residue.
customer_reviews.author: tahreem

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t Work for Me
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a minor tree branch scratch but it did not help at all. In the future I will buy the polisher and orange pads to pair with but by using a towel it definitely did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Brunson

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to work with
customer_reviews.text: This compound has a short working time and I hate using it. Once it dries you get white dust everywhere. I would suggest something like Griot's BOSS Fast Correcting Cream with a longer working time.
customer_reviews.author: D.Jones

customer_reviews.title: Top notch!
customer_reviews.text: The M105/M205 combination from Meguiar’s is capable of heavy paint correction while finishing with a high level of depth and gloss, and it does it in less time than traditional polishes. It does require a different technique than you may be used to, and it may take you a few times to get the system down to make it most effective. Once you’ve accomplished this however, you will be very pleased that you gave it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua W.

customer_reviews.title: Will give you a mirror shine
customer_reviews.text: I know this is supposed to be for cars, but I use it on guitar finishes. Apply it right and it really delivers
customer_reviews.author: James Schofield

customer_reviews.title: I used this to buff my guitar finish
customer_reviews.text: I used this as the first step to buff my guitar's final finish of Epoxy Resin. It really gets rid of the sanding marks in Epoxy. Very nice. I'll keep using this method until I can afford more expensive methods of guitar building and finishing.
customer_reviews.author: Russell A. Barber

customer_reviews.title: Great compound but be careful!
customer_reviews.text: The seller delivered quickly and price is great. The Meguiar's Ultra Cut Compound is an amazing product but you have to be careful how you use it because it can mess up your paint or surfaced very quickly. I tried it on my headlights and it's a big NO NO. Remember this product is to be utilized with a cutting/compound foam pad and on surfaces that had been sanded for better results. Have fun and just take your time...good luck!
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Meguiars - what else needs to be said?
customer_reviews.text: Quality product for taking care of things you care about. Worth every penny. Works extremely well for restoring plastic headlight housings to crystal clarity. Will require a polymer acrylic sealer with UV inhibitor to prevent yellowing/hazing of headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney D. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Works great on minor surface scratches
customer_reviews.text: Pics say it all! My husband cleaned our car a while back and used the abrasive side of a kitchen sponge and now the whole car (blue one in pics) is covered in tiny surface scratches. You can clearly see the difference in the test spot on the paint and headlights.
customer_reviews.author: kjski86

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: How is it possible to make a car shine. I wish I wasn't so lazy I would upload some photos... But take my word I live in a little place called Iwakuni Japan and all the Americans treat their vehicles like crap. After three years when they go to sell them I clean em up for them and they look as if they came off the factory floor. Use in conjunction with M205*
customer_reviews.author: Bill Cobb

customer_reviews.title: What Scratches and Swirl Marks?
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have used lots of different Meguiars products on my Camaro the last few years and this might be my favorite. All cars always tend to get those annoying swirl marks or deeper clear coat scratches. But this stuff will take out pretty much anything that is not deeper than the paint itself. I use this with my porter cable 7424xp buffer with the yellow chemical guys heavy cutting pad for all my deeper scratches and swirl marks and it will make your car as smooth as butter. If you clean your cars and like them looking pristine this is a must product!
customer_reviews.author: Jon B

customer_reviews.title: Difficult
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could have tried this product more. It was impossible to remove this after application. I even tried spraying a little spray detailer, but it was too difficult to keep using.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Use this as a three-part detailing system and the results are amazing-and long lasting! Use the compound first, follow with Meguiars 205 Polish, and then your wax of choice. Excellent results. Highly recommended. Tip: Use this on faded plastic headlamp covers, put a little elbow into it and you can really bring those headlights back-worked great on my Eclipse!
customer_reviews.author: VCMSound

customer_reviews.title: Works Great On Badly Stained Weld Racing Forged Weld Wheels
customer_reviews.text: Meguiars Ultra Cut 105 works great on Weld forged aluminum wheels. Wheels are heavily oxidized and stained from brake dust. I will follow up with Meguiars 205 and Mother’s Billet polish, I’m sure they’ll turn out great. Very pleased with the results of the Ultra Cut Compound.
customer_reviews.author: Jeepin’

customer_reviews.title: wow! I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I used the M105 after clay bar. Removed the fine scratches with just a small drop on my DA polisher. Impressive product.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Restored foggy/hazed headlights
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to restore foggy headlights on a 2008 Elantra. Used with a power drill buffing attachment. Noticeable difference in less then a minute of work.
customer_reviews.author: Jon W

customer_reviews.title: Stick with Chemical Guys V32
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product when I ran out of Chemical Guys V32. I was looking for an extremely coarse polish to remove "water marks" from shower glass. The product literature led me to believe this was a very coarse polish. However, compared to the V32 it cuts significantly more slowly. Would not recommend -- just stick with the V32.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Berg

customer_reviews.title: Old truck new shine
customer_reviews.text: My 2004 F-150 is always outside, it has been neglected for years. The hood and cab was moderately oxidized. I used the cutting compound, foam polishing pads and an electric buffer to cut all the crud off. Waxed and sealed and it looks great
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Kid's truck
customer_reviews.text: We bought a 2000 truck when the 1st of 4 kids started driving. The youngest just went off to school and after 16 years I got my truck back. Paint was very faded due to neglect. It took 6 hours to compound and polish and looks much better. Not prefect but significantly better.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Makes a car beautiful !
customer_reviews.text: Great compound , used on my headlights that had the brown haze covering them . Always assumed you had to take the covers off . Just rub this stuff in a few times and take off and it will disappear !! Also great for deep scratches . Love it !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Skip it and get something actually aggressive.
customer_reviews.text: I get the same results with this product as I do with their finishing polishes. Basically useless as a compound, let alone a heavy cut compound.
customer_reviews.author: bennett

customer_reviews.title: Use after cut compound 205 for perfect results
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. I used this after using their 205 cut compound to remove orange peel from a paint job and it brings it to a show car shine.
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: Works Fantastic - Pair with Black+Decker WP900 For DIY $40 Paint Fix
customer_reviews.text: I have a Black 2013 Honda CRV, only washed it by hand with standard microfiber towels over the last 5 years. Completely covered with micro scratches, I figured I would give this a go. If you're trying to give your car a nice coat for cheap, pair this with a BLACK+DECKER WP900 ($25-$30), and your car will have paint that looks nearly brand new. Of course don't expect deeper scratches to rub off, but it does amazing work and will indeed make a black paint look like a mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel King

customer_reviews.title: Did the job well.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but I had a scratch on my Jeep that I wanted to rub out and this product did the trick. I would definitely recommend. The bottle is probably a 20 year supply, but I'll be ready for the next 1,000 scratches...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Not exact work for my 2019 Jepp Cherokee. I feel like the paint is getting worse after apply it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B.

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: Work the product in circles till it's almost dry, wipe off and buff. It does get rid of small shallow scratches nicely. If it drys use a spray bottle while you buff it out
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: I've used Meguiar's products before and have always been happy with them
customer_reviews.text: I've used Meguiar's products before and have always been happy with them. Recently got some Ultra Cut Compound to try out on my old car that's been sitting in storage for years. After a couple passes with the Ultra Cut followed by their Ultra Finishing Compound the paint on the car looks as good as it ever has. Even with a less aggressive pad using this compound took some orange peel out of the paint and definitely removed a lot of oxidation.
customer_reviews.author: Shayne Voris

customer_reviews.title: Took the swirls off my Toyota Highlander SE
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my black 2018 highlander SE it worked really well. Bought a black and decker rotary orbiter. Had to go over the swirls from the car wash a few times to make a difference
customer_reviews.author: Yummy love

customer_reviews.title: Good product, economical
customer_reviews.text: IT is a lazy man's car wash, wash the car well plus it leaves a glaze to protect the car, wash and wax at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: ACW1120

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This product does what I wanted. Cuts with a mild buffer, revealing a smooth shine surface. Thank you. !!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Burke

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Sucks I had to buy this to take off ceramic coating I bought here. It takes more n more of each time. Do not do at home ceramic
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for removing swirls
customer_reviews.text: Great for removing swirls along with a Hex Logic pad. Finish up with a polishing compound and different pad.
customer_reviews.author: CB&PB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to remove paint overspray on my brand new car. I worked like a charm. It was easier to use that wax.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for mirrors
customer_reviews.text: I did a search for a product to remove scratches from mirrors. This product is for car paint. My bad for not reading the entire product description.

customer_reviews.title: Magic
customer_reviews.text: Works magically. I removed so many scratches. A must have living in NY

customer_reviews.title: Cuts shower sun well
customer_reviews.text: I use this to clean my shower and bathtub. Cuts faster then original recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Greg A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: 97 pickup shines now
customer_reviews.text: Worked good, removed 23yrs of oxidation and moderate scratches from 97 Chevy pickup.
customer_reviews.author: A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. It cuts like nothing else i've tried before... but damn the work time on it is painfully bad. This stuff starts dusting real quick. It is a pain to wipe off, especially if it cakes on. I'm going to try mothers cutting compound next time.
customer_reviews.author: Malibu Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great polish
customer_reviews.text: I was restoring my guitar and used this polish, now my guitar shines and looks good
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: if you know what you're doing, it works.
customer_reviews.text: used this with a DA and cutting pad and after a few passes all of my spider scratches are gone. was even able to get a few deeper scratches out with this setup, but i'm sure this compound paired with a wool pad and rotary would do the trick. no complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a car that I sanded down with 3000 grit sandpaper. This brought back the shine to the car and cleaned up very easily. Also worked well on areas that weren’t sanded
customer_reviews.author: Derrick B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff was recommended to me by our countertop ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff was recommended to me by our countertop person to use once a month to help our bathroom and kitchen counters stay scratch free and shiny. Great seller - super fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: jayner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shine and protecton.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to use, polish and shine. Easy to remove. I've since purchased this in the gallon size, because I liked it so much.
customer_reviews.author: private

customer_reviews.title: Works great to remove scratches.
customer_reviews.text: It did a nice job with my Black & Decker waxer. Took some scratches off my car.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Byers

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: M105 is step one of two for me when polising my car. When used with M205 gets all the swirls out of the car. Must use random orbit machine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money ... expectations were high.. sorry I bought it
customer_reviews.author: David Goldich

customer_reviews.title: This verses Turtle Wax polishing compound
customer_reviews.text: I had a small scratch and tried to buff it out with the Turtle Wax polishing compound. Scratch still there but less noticeable. I bought this and amazing, scratch completely disappeared. Dunno what the difference in ingredients but this one works. Maybe rubbing compound should have been used?
customer_reviews.author: Lily_Girl

customer_reviews.title: M105 scratchswirls etc remover
customer_reviews.text: Had some scratches on the tank remo ed most / I'll need to remove the speedo and top chrome to do in depth job but very happy with M105

customer_reviews.title: Replace my neighbors
customer_reviews.text: I ran out and had to borrow my neighbors bottle. Works great

customer_reviews.text: It dries fast so not easy to use. Need to remove fast, not much time to buff, polish. Does work well in removing scratches

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great for heavy oxidation. Use with a DA system or other powered polisher. Pictures posted show the results. Black paint on 2004 Volvo.

customer_reviews.title: Five stars, all day long, twice on sundays. BUY NOW
customer_reviews.text: Truly my amazing product. I only got to do a light buff. But I'm using chemical guys hex logic pads. Using a orange pad for this compound. The results are better than I could have ever imagined . I plan on finish with M205 compund and a white hex logic pad. I ordered a 8oz bottle. Which is enough to do my entire Audi twice

customer_reviews.title: Good medium compound
customer_reviews.text: Meguiar's is trusted product and I like it. Small 8 oz bottle but you don't need much.

customer_reviews.title: Great polish
customer_reviews.text: This was just one of nine items ordered for my husband to work on our Kitchen Countertops.

customer_reviews.title: Great price and product
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy, it did what I expected. Took several small scratches out of what I was working on.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I use it on eisenglass boat curtains ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I use it on eisenglass boat curtains to remove scratches and restore clearness. Works great on headlight plastic covers.
customer_reviews.author: Franktoo

customer_reviews.title: Great cutting compound
customer_reviews.text: I use this to cut through nasty dull headlights. works like a charm
customer_reviews.author: Henry J

product_meta.title: Meguiar's M10508 Mirror Glaze Ultra-Cut Compound, 8 Fluid Ounces, 1 Pack
product_meta.description: Use Meguiar’s M105 Mirror Glaze Ultra-Cut Compound to remove scratches, severe swirls/holograms, acid rain and other defects from your paint finish and leave it with a best-in-class mirror-like gloss. Our exclusive super micro-abrasive technology features ultra-fast cutting ability to remove 1200 grit or finer sanding marks. This professional grade formula is safe and effective on all glossy paint finishes, including clear coats.
feature_bullets: DEFECT REMOVAL: Great for removing scratches, defects, acid rain and severe swirls/holograms
ULTRA-FAST COMPOUNDING: Ultra-fast cutting removes 1200 grit or finer sanding marks
SUPERIOR FINISH: Exclusive super micro-abrasive technology leaves best-in-class finish
CLEAR COAT SAFE: Safe and effective on all glossy paint finishes including clear coats
VERSATILE USE: Formulated for use by hand, dual action polisher or rotary buffer, and is body shop safe. Also available in 32 oz and 1 gallon sizes

specifications.Cover Included: Auto part, Automotive Accessories, Replacement and Performance parts
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,125 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
